intro: Ammobium spathulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed burrhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny seed pods that enclose its seeds. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in whorls. Ammobium spathulatum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
